intro: Campylocera leptocarpa, commonly known as the slender-fruited campylocera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapotaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated fruits and small, simple leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. While not widely cultivated, it is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
